qas.question: What planet seemed to buck Newton's gravitational laws?
What planet did astrophysisist predict to explain the problems with Mercury?
What theory accounted for the Mercury problem?
Who came up with the theory of relativity?
Who first showed that Newton's Theory of Gravity was not as correct as another theory?
Whose law did not explain the orbit of the planet Saturn?
Who predicted the existence of many other planets?
The planet Vulcan was predicted to explain the what with planet Saturn?

context: It was only the orbit of the planet <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3>Mercury<a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> that <b5_0><b7_0>Newton's Law of Gravitation<b7_0/><b5_0/> seemed not to fully explain. Some <b6_0>astrophysicists<b6_0/> predicted the existence of another planet (<a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3>Vulcan<a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>) that would explain the <b8_0>discrepancies<b8_0/>; however, despite some early indications, no such planet could be found. When <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3>Albert Einstein<a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> formulated his <a2_0><a2_1>theory of <a2_2><a2_3>general relativity<a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_0/> (GR)<a2_1/> he turned his attention to the problem of Mercury's orbit and found that his theory added a correction, which could account for the discrepancy. This was the first time that Newton's Theory of Gravity had been shown to be less correct than an alternative.
